abstract: Mr. Whitehead laid the groundwork for Open Skies, the policy that led to the creation of the domestic satellite system that brought cable television into millions of American homes.
snippet: Mr. Whitehead laid the groundwork for Open Skies, the policy that led to the creation of the domestic satellite system that brought cable television into millions of American homes.
lead_paragraph: Clay T. Whitehead, the official in the Nixon administration who laid the groundwork for Open Skies, the policy that led to the creation of the domestic satellite system that brought cable television and lower-cost long-distance telephone service into millions of American homes, died in Washington on July 23. He was 69 and lived in McLean, Va.

headline.main: Clay T. Whitehead, Guide of Policy That Helped Cable TV, Is Dead at 69
headline.print_headline: Clay T. Whitehead, Guide of Policy That Helped Cable TV, Is Dead at 69
